PRLTAO AC</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="500" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Anderson, K.; Armstrong, R.; Andrews, R.; Adamson, P.; Allison, W.W.M.; Andrews, M.; Alner, G.J.; Michael, D.G.; Alexopoulos, T.; Andreopoulos, C.; Arms, K.E.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="506" ind1=" " ind2="0"><subfield code="a">Free-to-read</subfield><subfield code="f">Unrestricted online access</subfield><subfield code="2">star</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="520" ind1="3" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">This letter reports results from the MINOS experiment based on its initial exposure to neutrinos from the Fermilab NuMI beam. The rates and energy spectra of charged current ν{sub μ} interactions are compared in two detectors located along the beam axis at distances of 1 km and 735 km. With 1.27 x 10²° 120GeV protons incident on the NuMI target, 215 events with energies below 30GeV are observed at the Far Detector, compared to an expectation of 336 ± 14.4 events. The data are consistent with ν{sub μ} disappearance via oscillations with </subfield><subfield code=" ">= 2.74{sub -0.26}{sup +0.44} x 10⁻³ eV²/c⁴ and sin² (2θ₂₃) > 0.87 (68% C.L.).</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="536" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="b">AC02-76CH03000</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="650" ind1=" " ind2="7"><subfield code="a">Physics Of "fermilab-pub-06-243" "arXiv eprint number hep-ex/0607088" Phys.Rev.Lett.97:191801,2006 97 ISSN 0031-9007; PRLTAO AC Anderson, K.; Armstrong, R.; Andrews, R.; Adamson, P.; Allison, W.W.M.; Andrews, M.; Alner, G.J.; Michael, D.G.; Alexopoulos, T.; Andreopoulos, C.; Arms, K.E. Free-to-read Unrestricted online access star This letter reports results from the MINOS experiment based on its initial exposure to neutrinos from the Fermilab NuMI beam. The rates and energy spectra of charged current ν{sub μ} interactions are compared in two detectors located along the beam axis at distances of 1 km and 735 km. With 1.27 x 10²° 120GeV protons incident on the NuMI target, 215 events with energies below 30GeV are observed at the Far Detector, compared to an expectation of 336 ± 14.4 events. The data are consistent with ν{sub μ} disappearance via oscillations with  = 2.74{sub -0.26}{sup +0.44} x 10⁻³ eV²/c⁴ and sin² (2θ₂₃) > 0.87 (68% C.L.).
